snippet: Less than 48 hours after a runoff election, signs of a political crisis emerged with the campaign of Abdullah Abdullah claiming there had been widespread ballot stuffing.
abstract: Campaign of Afghan presidential candidate Abdullah Abdullah is making claims of widespread ballot stuffing in runoff election, suggesting he is being set up for defeat he will not accept; believes Pres Hamid Karzai and his advisers orchestrated the fraud, either to install opponent Ashraf Ghani, or to use postelection crisis to extend his own term in office.

byline.original: By MATTHEW ROSENBERG and AZAM AHMED
byline.contributor: Haris Kakar and Jawad Sukhanyar contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Less than 48 hours after a runoff election, signs of a political crisis emerged with the campaign of Abdullah Abdullah claiming there had been widespread ballot stuffing.

headline.main: Afghan Candidate Alleges Voting Fraud by Karzai and Aides
headline.print_headline: Afghan Candidate Alleges Voting Fraud by Karzai and Aides
